spell.name: Absolute Zero
entries: The temperature in a 50-foot-radius sphere centered on a point in range suddenly drops to absolute zero, as cold as the depths of outer space.

Everyone in range must make a Constitution save. A creature takes {@damage 10d10} cold damage on a failed save and is frozen solid, {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. On a successful save, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn and takes only {@damage 5d10} cold damage.

spell.name: Absorb Power
entries: When you touch a willing creature who possesses superpowers, you may absorb one of their powers of a level for which you have power slots or reflexive powers.

You may then use the power as though it was your own for the duration. During this time, the original possessor is unable to use the power. When you use the power, you must expend a slot as normal, unless you have reflexive powers at that level, in which case you can use the absorbed power reflexively as well

To use this power on an unwilling target, you must first observe them using the power. Once you have direct experience of the target using the power, you must make skin-to-skin contact to attempt to absorb their power. Your

GM may decide that a melee power attack is required. If you succeed in touching them, the target must make a Charisma save against your power DC. On a failed save, you absorb the specific power, and they lose the use of it for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you use this power using a slot of 4th or 5th level, the duration of the power increases to 10 minutes. If you use a slot of 6th or 7th level, the duration increases to 1 hour. If you use a slot of 8th or 9th level, the duration increases to 1 day.

spell.name: Acid Jet
entries: Caustic acid shoots from your hands in a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide in 2 directions you choose. The blasts can be in the same direction, but the damage does not double.

Instead, the 2 lines combine into a single 10-foot-wide line that does the same damage. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 9d8} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Acid Touch
entries: You may cause your skin to secrete acid. You may choose to have this acid emerge from all or part of your body. Make a melee power attack against a creature within your reach.
On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} acid damage.
You may also use this acid to burn through objects, though it may take time. The acid cannot be harvested or collected, however; once it is removed from your skin it loses its potency.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), 14th level ({@dice 4d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d12}).

spell.name: Advanced Hack
entries: You send a lethal script to a computer or security system in range, gaining full access to its administrative functions.

When you hack or disable such security systems, you go undetected unless someone uses an action to make an {@skill Investigation} check that beats a DC equal to 8 + your Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus.

spell.name: After Image
entries: You disappear and a visual illusion of you appears somewhere you've been in the past minute in range. The image exactly duplicates what you were doing at the time.

As long as you maintain focus, the illusion continues to recreate what you were doing 1 minute in the past, while you remain {@condition invisible}. While {@condition invisible}, you are hidden from everyone's sight.

Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful {@skill Investigation} check against your power save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.
Nevertheless, you remain {@condition invisible} for the duration. The power ends also ends if you attack or use another power.

spell.name: Alter Density
entries: You can choose to alter your density as a reaction whenever you must make a Strength or Dexterity save or {@skill Athletics} or {@skill Acrobatics} check. Rather than changing your body mass when you stretch and retract, you can keep you shape the same and increase or decrease your density, becoming heavier or lighter. When you activate this power and choose to increase your density, you have advantage on {@skill Athletics} checks and Strength saves to resist being shoved, knocked {@condition prone}, or moved against your will.
If you choose to decrease your density, on the other hand, you gain advantage on Dexterity saves and {@skill Acrobatics} checks.

You may maintain your altered density as long as you concentrate on this power. As an action, you may choose to switch from increasing your density to decreasing it, or vice versa, for the duration of this power.

spell.name: Alter Metabolism
entries: You have remarkable control over your body, including your metabolic processes; when you activate this power, you choose whether to accelerate or slow them. If you choose to slow them down, your heart rate and breathing slow significantly and your body temperature drops. You need very little air and no food or water during the time you focus on this power. Further, you have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks, but your speed is cut in half, and you cannot use the {@action Dash} or {@action Attack} actions.
If you choose to speed up your metabolism, on the other hand, your speed increases by 10 feet and you heal 1 HP every 1 minute, as you accelerate the natural healing process.

spell.name: Animated Sword
entries: You create a sword-shaped plane of your Elemental
Manifestation that hovers in range, lasting for the duration.
When the sword appears, you make a melee power attack against a target within 5 feet of the sword. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} damage and suffers an Elemental Effect.
The type of damage and the Elemental Effect the target suffers is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables.
Until the power ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a visible spot and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Anvil Drop
entries: As an Action, you may select a Large or smaller object in range weighing less than 2000 lb. With a quick exertion of effort, you teleport the object above a point in range, dropping the object onto whatever is below. Each creature within 5 feet of the target must make a Dexterity save. On a failed save, creatures in the area take {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage, or half on a successful save. Regardless of whether the target makes the save or not, the teleported object also takes {@damage 8d8} bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Aboreal Form
entries: You transform yourself into a massive humanoid tree, capable of walking and talking.
When in your chosen species of arboreal form, your game statistics are the same, with the following exceptions:

items: Your size is Huge.
You gain 100 temporary HP.
Your AC is 16 and you are resistant to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.
You can't use powers, though you retain your ability to speak and your walking speed.

entries: Transforming doesn't break your {@status concentration} on a power you've already used, however, or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a power, such as call lightning.
You can make unarmed attacks using your power attack bonus, dealing {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage on a hit.
You retain the benefit of any features from your class, ancestry, culture, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so.
You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn, though you lose the temporary
HP. You automatically revert if you fall {@condition unconscious}, drop to 0 HP, or die.
You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space or merges into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect until you leave the form.

spell.name: Arcane Sword
entries: You create a sword-shaped plane of force that hovers in range, lasting for the duration.

When the sword appears, you make a melee power attack against a target within 5 feet of the sword. A hit causes {@damage 3d10} force damage. Until the power ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to move the sword up to 20 feet to a visible spot and repeat this attack against the same target or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Assassinate
entries: When given an opportunity to prepare yourself, you can be a deadly killer. The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this power ends, you deal an extra {@damage 12d6} force damage. This damage cannot be added to a power attack.

spell.name: Autonomous Drone
entries: You deploy a simple, autonomous drone. Appearing in an unoccupied space in range, it has the statistics listed below.

Your drone acts independently of you, but always obeys your commands. In combat, it rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. An autonomous drone can't attack, but it can take other actions as normal.
When the drone drops to 0 HP, it malfunctions, but you can deploy a new version when you use this power again.
While your autonomous drone is within 100 feet of you, you can communicate with it telepathically. Additionally, as an action you can:

items: see through the drone's camera and hear through its microphone until the start of your next turn. During this time, you are deaf and blind regarding your own senses.
temporarily deactivate your drone, causing it to shut down. As a further action while it is temporarily deactivated, you can transfer its programming to a new drone within 30 feet of you.

entries: You can't have more than 1 autonomous drone at a time.
If you use this power while you already have a drone, the old one deactivates.

data.name: Autonomous Drone
data.pbNote: +2 Recording device. When the drone is active, it records audio and video from its surroundings, sending it back via cellular or satellite network to its home base or owner.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} +3 to hit, reach 5 feet, 1 target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: An explosion of ice, snow, and rock cascades from you.

Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Strength save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@dice 2d6} cold and {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a success, the creature takes half as much and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the power's effect, and the area is difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Barricade
entries: You pick up or rip up a large chunk of your environment—pavement at your feet, a nearby wall, or even a parked car—and prop it up in front of you to use as a makeshift barricade. This barricade is 10 feet wide and 10 feet tall, and at least a foot thick of solid material, which is more than enough to stop most attacks. It collapses under its own weight after a minute, or after it has sustained 30 points of damage. You can shape the barricade into a 10-foot wide and tall semicircle if you prefer, as well as a dome just large enough to cover 2 Medium creatures.

spell.name: Beguile
entries: This power grants you advantage on Charisma checks toward 1 creature who can hear and understand you in range for the duration, if the creature is not hostile toward you. Perhaps you project positive affect into the creature's mind or cloak yourself in an appealing illusion.
When the power ends, the creature knows you tricked it and becomes angry with you, which may lead it to seek revenge or compensation.

spell.name: Biomagnetic Control
entries: You can sense and control the organic metals within living beings. A visible creature in range must make a Constitution save or be {@condition restrained}. This and each subsequent round, you can use your action to either move the {@condition restrained} creature around at a rate of 30 feet, or rip the iron from their bodies, doing {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage. At the end of each of the creature's turns, they can make another Constitution save to resist the power. If the creature makes their save, you can use your action to shift this power to a different creature in range, causing them to make the save as if you had used the power on them for the first time.

spell.name: Blind Spot
entries: If you remain perfectly still and quiet, you can momentarily hide in plain sight. As an action while remaining quiet and immobile, you are {@condition invisible} to 1 visible creature within 30 feet. To the creature, you seem to disappear for a moment, as if you had stepped into their blind spot. You blink back into visibility for them at the beginning of your next turn.
You remain visible to all other creatures in the area.

spell.name: Blindsight
entries: You focus your attentions away from sight and to your other senses. For the duration, you have {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet.

spell.name: Blitz Attack
entries: Using agility, speed, or teleportation, you careen around the battlefield, striking up to 6 visible foes in range who are not behind total cover. Each target must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage. As you move across the battlefield, you cannot be hit with opportunity attacks. You end the action in a space in range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, you can hit 2 additional targets for each level over 6th.

spell.name: Blood Control
entries: You reach out and take control of the water within a living creature. It must make a Constitution save or you successfully twist the tissues of the creature, incapacitating it, dealing {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage, and causing it intense pain. For the duration, you can use your action to take control of the target, moving it in crude motions like a puppet. While you control it, you can force the target to move half its speed in any direction and make a single melee weapon attack against a target you choose in range.
When you use your action to control the target, it takes an additional {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target may make another Constitution save.
On a success, the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a 7th-level slot or above, the duration is {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes.

spell.name: Bombard
entries: You grab something nearby or on your person and throw it—hard. Make a ranged power attack against a target in range. On a hit, you deal {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), 14th level ({@dice 4d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d10}).

spell.name: Boost
entries: If at least one of your allies can hear you and is in range, you can cheer them on. Add two points to the Team Morale pool.

spell.name: Botanical Constructs
entries: You call forth woody roots from the ground in a 30-foot square in range, forming them into a simple inanimate shape that fits in a 30-foot cube. For example, you could create a wall in any simple shape you choose that fits in the space. It can be up to 30-foot long, straight, semicircular, or domed. Alternatively, you can create a structure like a bridge, stairs, or a ladder.

You can also use a bonus action to move the construct around in range at a speed equal to your own, though it must always stay rooted in the ground. This means that you can create an elevator lifting for yourself or others 30 feet in the air. Each botanical object can sustain 30 points of damage before is shatters.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, you can create 1 additional construct of the same size for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Botanical Form
entries: You transform your flesh and bones into plant matter, with sap for veins and a thick, tough bark for skin. When in your botanical form, your game statistics are the same, with the following exceptions:

items: Your creature type is Plant.
You gain 20 temporary HP.
Your AC cannot be less than 16 and you are resistant to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.
You can't use powers, though you retain your other abilities.

entries: Transforming doesn't break your {@status concentration} on a power you've already used or prevent you from taking actions that are part of a power, such as call lightning.
You can make unarmed attacks using your power attack bonus, dealing {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage on a hit.
You retain the benefit of any features from your class, ancestry, culture, or other source and can use them if the new form is physically capable of doing so.
You can revert to your normal form earlier by using a bonus action on your turn, though you lose the temporary
HP. You automatically revert if you fall {@condition unconscious}, drop to 0 HP, or die.
You choose whether your equipment falls to the ground in your space or merges into your new form. Equipment that merges has no effect until you leave the form.

spell.name: Bottomless Pit
entries: You create a 30-foot radius illusory pit in range. To any creatures in the area, it appears as though a chasm has opened beneath them, and they are falling. Every creature in range must make an Intelligence save or fall {@condition prone}, flail about, and believe themselves falling in a bottomless pit.

They remain that way for the duration, or until someone else uses their action to shake them back to reality. Beings that can fly may be convinced that the hole is real, but they won't fall to the ground and flail. Creatures who make a successful save momentarily believe themselves to be falling and fall {@condition prone} and remain there until the start of their turn, when they realize the hole is an illusion.

As an action while the power is ongoing, you can make those who believe themselves to be falling to strike illusory ground. They hit with enough force that they think themselves injured, taking {@damage 6d6} psychic damage.
The illusion ends when this occurs.

spell.name: Bull's Rush
entries: You lunge forward with extreme force. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before taking the attack action, you gain a +5 bonus to the attack's damage roll if you hit with a melee attack. On a hit, a Large or smaller target must make a Strength save against your power save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Burrow
entries: Until the power ends, you gain the ability to travel through earth and soil freely. You gain a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed. You cannot move through worked stone, cement, or any kind of metal or human-made material, however.

spell.name: Burst of Speed
entries: You focus all your attentions on moving as quickly as you can, resulting in speeds that defy the laws of human physiology and even physics. If you {@action Dash} for your action, your speed multiplies by ten. If on your turn you use your action for anything other than the {@action Dash} action, your {@status concentration} is broken, this power ends, and your movement returns to normal.

entries.name: How Fast is That?
entries: For a {@spell burst of speed|Superheroic5E} example, a 7th level hero with the speed Kinetic talent has a base walking speed of 120 feet. If such heroes use this power, they have a base walking speed of 1200 feet, though they would have to dash to use it, raising their speed to 2400 feet. If they can {@action Dash} as a bonus action as well, thanks to a power such as {@spell expeditious retreat}, that totals to 3600 feet per round, or roughly 400 mph.

A 20th level hero with the speed Kinetic talent has a movement speed of 2400 feet, so their movement speed would be 24,000 feet per turn using {@spell burst of speed|Superheroic5E}, which means they would move 72,000 feet per turn if they use their action and bonus action to dash. That's or over 8,000 mph! Combined with a power like {@spell supersonic flight|Superheroic5E}, such a hero could circle the globe in a single round!

spell.name: Cacophony
entries: You create a deafening noise of concentrated sound inside a 30-foot cube in range. Each creature that begins its turn in the area or enters it for the first time that turn must make a Constitution save or suffer {@damage 4d8} thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} and nauseated for the duration. If the creature is {@condition deafened}, they suffer the {@condition poisoned} condition as well.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Catch Your Breath
entries: As an action, you stop to catch your breath. When you use this power, you are {@condition stunned} until the beginning of your next turn, but you may expend 1 Hit Die to recover HP.
The number of Hit Dice you can expend increases to 2 when you reach 5th level, 3 at 11th level, 4 at 14th level, and 5 at 17th level.

spell.name: Caustic Spray
entries: With a wave, a spray of caustic acid fills the air before you.

Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much and are not {@condition blinded} on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Challenge
entries: You call out a challenge to a visible creature in range. If it understands you, it must make a Wisdom save. On a failed save, you successfully goad the creature into focusing its attacks on you. For the duration, the creature has disadvantage on attacks that do not target you and cannot move further away from you than it currently is.
The effect ends if you attack or use a power on a different creature, or if you move out of range from the target.

spell.name: Chameleon
entries: Like a chameleon, you alter the texture and color of your skin and gear to blend into your environment. In dim light or darkness, you are {@condition invisible}. In bright light, you remain {@condition invisible} when you remain still or move stealthily at half speed or less. When you move at full speed in bright light, creatures have disadvantage on their {@skill Perception} checks to see you.

spell.name: Channel Elder God
entries: You call forth an elder god who sleeps beyond death, offering your body as a portal to this reality. Vile, slimy tentacles erupt from your torso, crushing and binding everyone in an area in front of you.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Dexterity save or take {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage, {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage, and be {@condition restrained} by the tentacles until the power ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the tentacles takes {@damage 4d10} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the tentacles can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your power save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
What's more, the ground in the area is now coated with a slimy ectoplasm, rendering it difficult terrain for everyone but you.

spell.name: Charge
entries: As an action after moving in a straight line toward a target for at least ten feet, you may use your forward momentum to perform an attack on a target within 5 feet of your location after moving. A successful melee power attack causes the target {@damage 2d12} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Chill of Night
entries: You reduce the ambient energy in an area in range, cooling and darkening it. If the area was brightly lit, it is now dimly lit. If it was dimly lit, it is now dark. In addition, living creatures who start their turn in the area must make a CON save or have disadvantage on their next attack roll, skill check, or saving throw, as they are distracted by the sudden cooling and darkening of the area. The power has no effect on constructs and undead.

spell.name: Chill of the Grave
entries: Yo u l owe r yo u r b o dy temperature and vital signs until you resemble a corpse. For the duration, you are {@condition paralyzed}, have resistance to cold and necrotic damage, immunity to disease and poison, and are indistinguishable from a dead body.

spell.name: Circle of Death
entries: A sphere of negative energy ripples out to a 60-foot-radius sphere from a point in range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution save, taking {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Combat Drone
entries: You deploy a Tiny drone in range that operates for the duration or until you use this power again. The drone does not count as a creature or object but is a power effect created by the Tech hero. When you use the power, you can command the drone to emit a localized electrical shock. Make a melee power attack against a creature within 5 feet of the drone. On a hit, the target takes lightning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your power ability modifier.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the drone to move up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 2nd.

spell.name: Command Substance
entries: You may exert your will over 1 visible instance of your
Elemental Manifestation in range that is no larger than a 5-foot cube. You may mentally command it to do one of the following:

items: You cause the substance to slowly move by 5 feet in one direction, if there is a space, a suitable surface, or fuel for it. For example, fire needs something flammable and lightning needs something conductive, though cold, air, or smoke can move in any direction that is not fully blocked, and solids and liquids like stone, water, or acid can slide anywhere there is a flat surface.

entries: Similarly, light and darkness can move through empty spaces as well.

items: You remove the instance of the substance, extinguishing fires, melting ice, evaporating acids or water, dispersing light or shadow, crumbling stone, or canceling an electrical charge.

You cause the substance to take a specific shape that you control, though it cannot grow larger than a 5-foot cube. The element may form any shape, stationary or moving, within the 5-foot cube. Unless you use an action to dismiss the elemental shape, it retains this shape for ten minutes. You may have up to 3 effects active at a time and can also end any effect early with an action.

entries: The substance you command may have effects on the area into which you command it to move. If you move ice, water, or mud across an area of ground, that area becomes difficult terrain until the beginning of your next turn. An area of acid, fire, or lightning becomes harmful until the beginning of your next turn as well, doing {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type to creatures that end their turns in the space with the substance.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Commune with Biosphere
entries: You attune yourself to the biosphere of the planet itself, communing with whole ecosystems and sensing the ebb and flow of life across the surface of the planet. While harmonizing in this way, you automatically become aware of any serious harm to the planet's biosphere, like an oil spill, a forest fire, or a mass extinction. As an action, you can focus your attention on a specific natural location or a living beast or plant you are familiar with on the planet. Your senses perceive its environment as if you were standing at its location.
When you focus your attention in this way, you can speak to those in its vicinity in your own voice, which echoes up from the ground.
If you remain in communion with the biosphere, you slowly heal your body, gaining 1 HP per minute.

spell.name: Contort
entries: On a turn in which you are using your Action to attempt to escape a grapple, you may use your bonus action to supernaturally contort yourself, granting a +5 bonus on the first {@skill Acrobatics} check you make that round to escape from being {@condition grappled}.

spell.name: Control Weather-S5E
entries: You take control of the weather within 5 miles of you for the duration. You must be outdoors to use this power.
Moving to a place where you don't have a clear path to the sky ends the power early.

When you use the power, you change the current weather conditions, which are determined by the GM based on the climate and season. You can change precipitation, temperature, and wind. It takes {@dice 1d4 × 10} minutes for the new conditions to take effect. Once they do so, you can change the conditions again. When the power ends, the weather gradually returns to normal.
When you change the weather conditions, find a current condition on the following tables, and change its stage by one, up or down. When changing the wind, you can also change its direction.

entries.caption: Perception
rows: Torrential rain, driving hail, or blizzard

spell.name: Corrosive Sweat
entries: As an action, you exude acid from your skin. A creature grappling you must release you or take {@damage 1d10} acid damage each round it continues to grapple you. Furthermore, your sweat eats through restraints, destroying rope in 2 rounds and handcuffs in ten.

spell.name: Corrupting Touch
entries: With a touch, you momentarily corrupt the mind or body of another creature. Make a melee power attack. On a hit, the creature is {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Cosmic Chasm
entries: You call forth a void of freezing darkness, akin to deep space, which fills a 20-foot-radius sphere, centered on a point in range for the duration. Any creature that begins its turn in the area it enters if for the first time that round must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 6d6} cold damage. All creatures who rely on sight are {@condition blinded} while in the area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Counterpunch
entries: When you are hit by a visible melee attack, you can use your reaction to counterpunch. As a part of this reaction, you can make a melee attack against the creature who attacked you.

spell.name: Critical Strike

time.condition: when you score hit on a target

entries: against which you have advantage

entries.name: Range:
entries: Self

entries.name: Duration:
entries: Instantaneous

You have a knack for finding the weak points in your foes and exploiting them. When you successfully hit a foe with a weapon attack in a situation in which you make the attack with advantage, you can use your reaction to turn your hit into a critical hit.

spell.name: Crush
entries: You radically increase the weight of a visible foe or object in range by increasing gravity's pull on their mass. They are crushed by the gravitational forces and pressed against the ground. The creature must make a Strength save or take {@damage 3d10} force damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. While {@condition prone}, they are {@condition restrained}. Each round, you can use your action to subject them to another pulse of gravitational pressure, crushing them again, and dealing another {@damage 3d10} force damage. At the end of each of their turns, they can attempt the save again, on a success, the power ends.
Objects subjected to this effect that are not being worn or carried fall to the ground and take the damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use this power with a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Crushing Grip
entries: As an action, you can attempt to grapple 1 or 2 Large or smaller creatures within 5 feet of you, each with an empty hand. If a target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. On a success, the creature is {@condition grappled}. While your hands are grappling the target, you can use a bonus action to crush them. When you do so, each target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your Strength modifier. If you choose to use both hands to grapple a single creature, then on a success the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the bonus action bludgeoning damage is {@dice 4d6} + your Strength modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damages increase by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Danger Sense
entries: You gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby are amiss, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. Whenever you must make a Dexterity or Constitution save against an effect you can sense, such as traps or powers, you can use your reaction to give yourself advantage on the roll. You may use this reaction after you have rolled once for your save but before the GM has determined whether you succeeded or not. To gain this benefit, you can't be {@condition incapacitated}.

spell.name: Darkness-S5E
entries: Superpowered darkness spreads from a point you choose in range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration.
The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with

{@sense Darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and nonsuperpowered light can't illuminate it. If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helmet, blocks the darkness.
If any of this power's area overlaps with an area of light created by a power of 2nd level or lower, the power that created the light is dispersed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Death From Above
entries: As an action when you are about to land, either from falling, jumping, levitating, flying, or teleporting, you may use your downward momentum to perform an attack on a target within 5 feet of your landing location. A successful melee power attack causes the target {@damage 2d12} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Defensive Drone
entries: You deploy a Tiny drone that hovers around you and projects a defensive force field. The drone does not count as a creature or object but is a power effect created by the Tech hero. The force field protects you as if you were wielding a shield, adding +2 to your Armor Class. It hovers in your space, following you as you move. The drone remains active for 10 minutes, until you use a bonus action to end this effect, or until you are {@condition incapacitated} or die, at which point the drone falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

spell.name: Deflect Projectiles
entries: When you are targeted by a visible ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deflect or catch the projectile.

When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10} + your Dexterity modifier + your level. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the projectile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, you can make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, which has a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 90 feet. On a hit, you deal the amount of damage you would have sustained had you been hit.

spell.name: Deftness
entries: Until the power ends, you cannot be {@condition grappled} and when you make a Dexterity check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15.

spell.name: Delay
entries: You cause 1 visible creature in range to experience a momentary hiccup in time. The targets make a Charisma save. On a failed save, the creature subtracts 10 from their initiative count for this combat, though it cannot go lower than 1.

spell.name: Deluge
entries: You rapidly condense ambient moisture and create a turbulent storm cloud, which unleashes a torrential downpour in the area you choose. Water quickly gathers, turning earth into mud and hard surfaces into quickmoving streams, making everywhere in its area difficult terrain and lightly obscured. The rain collects at an astonishing rate. Unless it has a quick and easy place to run off, it collects at a rate of 1 foot per minute across its area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the area of the cube affected by the power increases by 5 feet for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Despair
entries: You hum a maudlin tune, laced with melancholy, infecting your targets with debilitating despair. You use your power to influence up to 12 visible creatures in range and that can hear you. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this effect. Each target must make a Wisdom save. On a failed save, it drops {@condition prone} and does nothing for the round.
At the end of each of its subsequent turns, it may attempt the save again, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Discordant Susurrations
entries: You mutter fell words in an alien tongue, floating disharmonies through the air to 1 creature that can hear you in range. You need nor share a language with the creature, though it must have an Intelligence of 3 or higher to be affected. The strange sounds confound the target's brain so badly that it must make a Wisdom save. If it fails its save, it takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage and falls {@condition prone}, gripping its head in pain. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and doesn't fall {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Disperse Power
entries: Choose 1 superpowered effect in range and attempt to unweave its threads, rearranging reality to exclude it. Any power effect of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each power effect of 4th level or higher on the target, make your power ability check. The DC equals 10 + the power's level. On a successful check, the power ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a power on the target if the power's level is equal to or less than the slot level you used.

spell.name: DISTRACT
entries: Distractions always seem to pull people's attention away from you as you move through an area. Perhaps a flash of light or a sudden sound draws their eyes. For the duration, people tend not to look at you, so you have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks that rely on being unseen while you move.

spell.name: Duplicate Self
entries: A duplicate of you steps out from your space into an open space within 5 feet of you. The duplicate is a creature that can take actions and otherwise be affected as a normal creature. It appears to be the same person as you, but it has half the HP maximum, no powers or class abilities, and is formed without any equipment. Otherwise, the duplicate uses all your other statistics.

The duplicate is friendly to you and creatures you designate. It obeys your spoken commands, moving, and acting in accordance with your wishes and acting on your turn in combat. The duplicate lacks the ability to learn or become more powerful, so it never increases its level or other abilities, nor can it use any powers.
The duplicate lasts for the duration or until it drops to 0 HP, at which point it fades away into nothing.
If you use this power again, any currently active duplicates you created with this power are instantly destroyed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, you can produce an additional duplicate for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Eavesdrop
entries: For the duration, you can attune yourself to sounds in a specific visible location and hear your environment as if you were standing at that location. Thus, if you see people whispering 120 feet away, you can focus there and listen in on their conversation. On subsequent rounds, you may change the target of this power to another visible location in range. You can still hear your local environment but are at disadvantage on {@skill Perception} checks involving hearing in your local vicinity.

spell.name: Elasticity
entries: When you use this power, your body becomes so incredibly elastic you can extend your limbs a distance away from you up to your walking speed. You can flatten yourself until 1 inch thick, filling a ten-foot square with your paper-thin form. Regardless of shape, you have resistance to bludgeoning damage while in this form.
You can even form a part of your body into the shape of an inanimate object sized Tiny or Small, or the whole of your body into the shape of an inanimate object sized

Medium one, though it cannot be detailed or have working mechanisms. No part of your elastic body can detach without injury, however. When you adopt the form of an object, you only adopt its shape, not its color or appearance.
You can end this power and return to a solid form as an action.
You may also form your hand into a club or axe and use it to make a melee attack, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 5d8} plus your power ability modifier on a hit.
Work with your GM to determine the exact effects of the various forms you adopt. For example, you could use this power to:

items: stretch your limbs to make a melee attack or use a touch power up to 30 feet away.
grapple and restrain someone by wrapping a limb around them.
stretch yourself into a net to safely catch a falling person, or to slow your own fall like a parachute, or to glide.
roll yourself into a ball and bounce from wall to wall.
shape your finger into that of a key to open a lock.

entries: And so on.

spell.name: Electromagnetic Nudge
entries: As an action, you can extend your will to a metallic or electronic device or object in range to throw a switch, push a button, or otherwise do a single thing that you could do with a single motion. Alternatively, you can knock over or otherwise bump the object, causing it to move up to 1 foot. Finally, you can cause lights and screens in range to flicker and buzz with static.

spell.name: Electromagnetic Pulse
entries: You emanate a potent pulse of electromagnetic radiation in a 300-foot-radius sphere centered at a point in range, knocking out electronics and electrical systems in the area.
This power does not affect robotic PCs or superpowered tech, however, or any other tech that is shielded against
EMP blasts.

spell.name: Elemental Blade
entries: You evoke a blade of swirling elemental energy in a free hand. When you use this power, your Elemental

Manifestation determines what kind of energy and damage it manifests (as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations table). Acid blades hiss and sizzle green; sound blades hum and blur the air; darkness blades swirl with black necrotic energy; and so on.
The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.
You can use your action to make a melee power attack with the primordial blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elemental Blast
entries: You conjure forth your Elemental Manifestation, which shoots down your arm and rockets away from your outstretched hand, forming an elemental sphere to hurl at a visible target in range.
Make a ranged power attack against the target, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} damage and suffers an Elemental
Effect on a hit. The result is determined by your Elemental

Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables. For example, you might shoot a bolt of electricity, or an icy spear, or a glob of acid, or a sonic shockwave; it may have a stranger appearance, however, such as a gravitational, magnetic, or temporal fluctuation that causes the air to vibrate and shimmer.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Elemental Burst
entries: Your hand erupts with your Elemental Manifestation: a spray of sizzling acid, a ball of crackling lightning, a fan of smoking fire, a biting gust of cutting winds, a forceful thrust of several icy shards, a wave of churning water, a swirling shadow of necrotic energy, a blanket of crushing gravity, a swirl of temporally accelerated entropic decay, an electromagnetic pulse, lash of bright radiant light, a concussive blast of thunderous vibrations, or an explosion of crashing boulders. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 8d6} damage and suffer an Elemental Effect, or half as much on a successful save with no Effect. The result is determined by your Elemental
Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Elemental Cloud
entries: A swirling cloud of your Elemental Manifestation appears in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point in range.

Perhaps it is a cloud of burning cinders or bitter cold ice, causing ice or fire damage. Or a vortex of glowing radiant or shadowy necrotic energies, a cloud of static electricity, a haze of acid, a field of gravitational or temporal fluctuation, a barrage of stones, or a shredder of high-pressure wind or water slicing the air. The cloud spreads around corners and is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 mph) disperses it.

When the cloud appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The type of damage is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations table. A creature must also make this save when it enters the power's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from you in your chosen direction at the start of each of your turns.

spell.name: Elemental Shield
entries: When hit with a visible attack, you can use your reaction to conjure forth a solid shield made of your Elemental

Manifestation that appears in a form you describe (perhaps a solid manifestation of your element or a shimmering field of energy). For the duration, you have a +2 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack. If this raises your
AC above the attack roll, you do not suffer the triggering damage, having blocked it with your elemental shield.
Your shield disappears if you drop or release it.

spell.name: Elemental Form
entries: As an action, you transform your body, and anything you are wearing or carrying, into a living embodiment of your Elemental Manifestation. Until you use an action to transform out of your Elemental Form or until you are {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following features:

items: Any creature you choose who touches you takes {@damage 2d6} damage (type of damage is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations table). They take this damage at the end of each round they are in contact with your body.

You can emit an explosion of elemental energy in a 10-foot-radius sphere from your body. All creatures in range must make a Dexterity save against your power DC, taking {@damage 5d6} damage and suffering an Elemental Effect on a failed save or half as a much damage and no effect on a success. The result is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables.

entries: You describe how you appear in this form. Someone made of ice, fire, or earth appears as such, but someone made of gravitational, temporal, or magnetic energies may appear as a mercurial liquid, field of starry space, or pitch black field like a humanoid black hole.

spell.name: Elemental Rebuke

time.condition: which you take in response to being

entries: damaged by a visible creature within 60 feet of you

entries.name: Range:
entries: 60 feet

When you take damage from a visible attack, your Elemental Manifestation responds by lashing out at the foe. The creature must make a Dexterity save or takes {@damage 2d10} damage, or half as much on a success, and suffers an Elemental Effect on a hit. The result is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Elemental Storm
entries: When you use this power, a storm of sheets of churning energy of your Elemental Manifestation appears in a location you choose in range. Perhaps the sheets are of roaring flame or swirling sleet, doing ice or fire damage.
Or maybe they are walls of glowing radiant or shadowy necrotic energies, a sheet of electricity, or a thin haze of acidic gas. They may also be thin energy fields where time and space warp and churn.
The area of the storm consists of up to ten 10-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least 1 face adjacent to the face of another cube.
Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity save. It takes {@damage 7d10} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The type of damage is determined by your
Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental
Manifestations table.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d10} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Elemental Strike
entries: Your fists become coated or surrounded by a field of your Elemental Manifestation. Perhaps they crackle with electricity, which arcs from fist to fist; smolder as lava drips from your knuckles; become encircled by tiny tornadoes; or shimmer with temporal or gravitational energies. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} damage and suffers an Elemental Effect. The result is determined by your Elemental Manifestation, as indicated in the Elemental Manifestations and the Elemental Effects tables.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Empowered Word
entries: You utter a supercharged word, imbued with your extraordinary power. Choose any number of visible creatures in range, any that can hear you must make a Charisma save. On a failed save, a creature suffers an effect based on its current HP:

items: 50 HP or fewer: {@condition deafened} for 1 minute
40 HP or fewer: {@condition deafened} and {@condition blinded} for 10 minutes
30 HP or fewer: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition stunned} for 1 hour
20 HP or fewer: killed instantly

entries: Regardless of its current HP, a celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend that fails its save is forced back to its plane of origin (if it isn't there already) and can't return to your current plane for 24 hours by any means short of a wish power.

spell.name: Encrypt Message
entries: You write a message on paper or some other suitable writing material or write an electronic transmission such as an email or text and imbue it with a scrambling encryption that lasts for the duration.

To you and any creatures you designate when you use the power, the writing appears normal, written in your hand, and conveys whatever meaning intended when you wrote the text. To all others, the writing appears as if it were written in an unknown script that is unintelligible. Alternatively, you can cause the writing to appear to be an entirely different message, written in a different hand and language, though the language must be one you know.
Should the power be dispersed, the original script and the illusion both disappear.
A creature with {@sense truesight} can read the hidden message.

spell.name: Encumber
entries: You create a momentary gravitational field beneath a visible target in range. The creature must succeed on a Strength save or have its movement drop to zero until the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Endure Attack

time.condition: which you use when you receive

entries: bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage

entries.name: Range:
entries: Self

entries.name: Duration:
entries: Instantaneous
You absorb the brunt of an attack. You have resistance against the triggering instance of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage dealt from a source you can sense.

spell.name: Enhanced Enlarge/Reduce
entries: You cause yourself to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Everything you are wearing and carrying changes size with you, though any item you drop returns to normal size.

entries.name: Enlarge
entries: Your size quadruples in all dimensions and your weight is multiplied by 20. This growth increases your size by 2 categories—from Medium to Huge, for example. If there isn't enough room for you to quadruple its size, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the power ends, you also have advantage on Strength checks and saves. Your weapons also grow to match your new size, your attacks with them deal {@damage 2d6} extra damage for each size you grow.

entries.name: Reduce
entries: Your size is quartered in all dimensions and your weight is reduced to 1/20 of normal. This reduction decreases your size by 2 categories—from Medium to Tiny, for example. Until the power ends, you also have disadvantage on Strength checks and saves. Your weapons also shrink to match your new size; however, your attacks can still deal the same damage.

entries.name: Repetition
entries: On each subsequent turn after using this power, you may enlarge or reduce your size again. So, if you have enlarged yourself to Huge, doing so again you become Gargantuan. Your damage increases by {@dice 2d6} with each enlargement. Similarly, you may reduce yourself from Tiny to microscopic, though that is as small as you can go.

spell.name: Enhanced Hearing
entries: You attend to your aural environment, and particular sounds, which you interpret for additional information.

You can gauge a person's stature and exact location by the sound of their footsteps, the speed, direction, make, and model of a car by its engine noise, the location and exact firearm being used when you hear a gunshot, and so on. As an action, you can also listen to someone speak and hear stress or deception in their voice. While using this power, you have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that rely on hearing and {@skill Insight} checks related to listening to someone speak.

spell.name: Enlarge Strike
entries: Your fist or foot expands to be almost 3 times its typical size and density, allowing you to hit a foe with the force like a sledgehammer. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Entropic Wave
entries: A swirling mist of pitch-black entropic energy billows out from you, rotting everything in its path. Each creature in range must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of your next turn.
Creatures who make the save take half as much and are not {@condition blinded}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Environmental Adaptation
entries: Your body adapts to its surroundings. If your environment contains an environmental effect that deals 1 or more types of damage to you, you gain resistance to your choice of 1 of those damage types. For example, if you are on a hot, irradiated planet that deals fire and radiant damage, you can choose to be resistant to either fire or radiant damage, but not both.

Furthermore, you can breathe normally in your environment regardless of the atmosphere, and you have advantage on saves made against harmful gases and vapors (such as cloudkill and stinking cloud effects or inhaled poisons).

spell.name: Expansive Pocket
entries: You touch a container no larger than a backpack. For the duration, the container has an interior space much larger than its outside dimensions. If the container is the size of a small purse, pouch, or pocket which can normally hold <1/5 cubic foot or roughly 6 pounds of gear, it can now hold 5 cubic feet or 60 lb. If it is the size of a backpack, holding roughly 1 cubic foot or 30 lb. of gear, it can now hold 50 cubic feet or 400 lb. Purse-sized containers weigh 2 lb. and backpack sized containers 15 lb., regardless of what they contain, though all gear put into the container must be able to fit through its normal opening. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the container is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, its contents are scattered in the surrounding area. If the container is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but it must be put right before it can be used again.
At the end of the duration, its contents tumble out of the container onto the ground around it. If the container is sealed or otherwise prevented from emptying its contents, it ruptures.

spell.name: Expedite
entries: As a reaction when you roll initiative, you can accelerate 1 visible creature in range. They add a bonus to their initiative roll equal to 5 + your proficiency bonus.

spell.name: Explosive Strength
entries: By {@status concentration||concentrating} your energies, you increase your Strength to incredible levels. For the duration, you may add double your proficiency bonus to any roll that relies upon Strength, including melee attacks and damage, Strength skill checks and saves. If you would already add your proficiency bonus because you are proficient in the relevant skill, attack, or save, this means you add it 3 times.

spell.name: Extinguish
entries: You cause every light source within 60 feet of you to blink out. Flames snuff out, lightbulbs dim, and flashlights fail.
When the power ends, the lights return, as if nothing had happened; as an action, you can choose to end this power early.

spell.name: Extrude Spikes
entries: You deploy foot-long, sharp spikes from your body in all directions, protecting you from harm and damaging those you meet. Anyone who has {@condition grappled} you or you have {@condition grappled} takes {@damage 3d8} piercing damage at the beginning of their turn. Furthermore, whenever you are hit with a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage. And whenever you hit someone with a melee attack, your target also takes {@damage 1d8} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Faerie Fire-S5E
entries: Each object in a 20-foot cube in range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light. Any creature in the area when the power is use is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity save. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.
Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the area affected by the power increases by 5 feet for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Faithful Hound
entries: You conjure a phantom watchdog in an unoccupied visible space in range, where it remains for the duration, until you dismiss it as an action or move more than 100 feet away from it.

The hound is {@condition invisible} to all creatures except you and can't be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within 30 feet of it without first speaking the specified password the hound starts barking loudly. It sees {@condition invisible} creatures, can see into the Ethereal Plane, and ignores illusions.
At the start of each of your turns, the hound attempts to bite 1 creature within 5 feet of it that is hostile to you.
The hound's attack bonus is equal to your power ability modifier + your proficiency bonus. On a hit, it deals {@damage 4d8} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage from the hound's bite increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Fangs
entries: Your canine teeth lengthen and narrow to form sharp, snake-like fangs. When you use an action to attack with your fangs, make a melee power attack. On a hit, you do {@damage 1d4} piercing damage as well as {@damage 1d6} poison damage as you inject venom into their bodies.

The power's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for the piercing and {@dice 1d6} for the poison when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}, {@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}, {@dice 3d6}), 14th level ({@dice 4d4}, {@dice 4d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d4}, {@dice 5d6}).

spell.name: Far Grasp
entries: You point at a Tiny or smaller visible object weighing less than 10 pounds in range that is not being worn or carried. With a blink, you open your hand, and the object appears in it.

spell.name: Fast Forward
entries: You target 1 visible creature in range and attempt to transport them a short distance forward in time. The creature must make a Charisma save or blink out of existence, only to appear 3 rounds later in the same spot.
They do not experience the passage of time while gone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, you send the creature forward in time 1 additional round for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Fate's Favor
entries: Your fortune empowers you with heroic energy. Until the power ends, your attacks deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage on a hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Fear-S5E
entries: You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom save or drop whatever it is holding and become {@condition frightened} for the duration.

While {@condition frightened} by this power, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, it can make a Wisdom save, if successful, the power ends for that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the size of the cone affected by the power increases by ten feet for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Flash Freeze
entries: A blast of bitter cold explodes from your outstretched hand.
Each creature in a 20-foot cone must make a Constitution save, taking {@damage 5d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
The ground remains icy until the beginning of your next turn, rendering it difficult terrain.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Flight Mastery
entries: You can now effortlessly travel through the sky with speeds rivalling those of small aircraft For the duration, you gain a flying speed of 875 feet (roughly 100 mph)

spell.name: Flood
entries: You summon forth a gout of water that flows from you in a direction you choose. The wave of water can be up to 10 feet wide and 10 feet tall, flowing 120 feet away from you or until it strikes a solid barrier such as a wall, whichever occurs first. Each creature struck by the wave must make a Dexterity save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone}, and pushed away from you ten feet with the water. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much and isn't knocked {@condition prone} or pushed. The water extinguishes any flames in its area and dissipates, soaking into the ground and disappearing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Fly-S5E
entries: You gain a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the power ends, you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the power no longer requires {@status concentration} and can be ended at will.

spell.name: Force Armor
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective force surrounds it until the power ends.
The target's unarmored AC becomes 12 + its proficiency bonus + its Dexterity modifier. The power ends if the target dons armor, wields a shield, or the power is dismissed as an action.

spell.name: Force Missle
entries: You create 3 glowing darts of superpowered force. Each dart hits a visible creature in range. A dart deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} force damage to its target. They all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit 1 creature or several.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the power creates 1 more dart for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Forceful Strike
entries: Large, translucent fists of pure force form around your hands, allowing you to transfer that kinetic energy to a target with a punch. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Freeze
entries: You create a potent flash freeze in an area, projecting a beam of freezing water targeting a 5-foot square in range for the duration. Any creature in the square must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 2d8} cold damage, or half on a successful save. A creature that is already soaking wet makes the save with disadvantage. Any creature that moves into the square on its turn for the first time must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 1d6} cold damage and fall {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Freezing Sphere
entries: Frigid cold energy streaks from your fingertips to a point in range, where it explodes in a 60-foot-radius sphere.
Each creature within the area must make a Constitution save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage or half as much on a success.

If the globe strikes a body of water or a liquid that is principally water (excluding water-based creatures), it freezes the liquid to a depth of 6 inches over an area 30 feet square. This ice lasts for 1 minute. Creatures that were swimming near the surface are trapped in the ice.
A trapped creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your power save DC to break free.

You can refrain from firing the globe after completing the power if you wish. A small marble-sized globe, cool to the touch, appears in your hand. At any time, you, or a creature to whom you give the globe can throw it (to a range of 40 feet) or hurl it with a sling (to the sling's normal range). It shatters on impact, with the normal effect of using the power. You can also set the globe down without shattering it. After 1 minute, if the globe hasn't already shattered, it explodes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Frenzy
entries: You lose yourself in the heat of battle. On the turn you use this power and each subsequent turn for the duration, you can make a single melee weapon attack as a bonus action on each of your turns. You also cannot be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} and have resistance to psychic damage.

spell.name: Furious Onslaught
entries: You explode in a rapid-fire assault on nearby enemies.
Make a melee power attack against each creature of your choice within ten feet of you. You deal {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage to each creature you hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Glare
entries: You glare at 1 visible creature in range, cursing them with a foul fate. The target must succeed on a Wisdom save or be {@condition poisoned} for the duration. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target 1 additional creature for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Glibness
entries: Until the power ends, when you make a Charisma check, you can replace the number you roll with a 15. Perhaps you emanate a telepathic field of confidence or project an illusion of charm. Regardless of what you say, a power that would determine if you were telling the truth indicates you are being truthful.

spell.name: Glide
entries: While falling, you can use this power to glide horizontally.

For the round, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, but you must move your full movement horizontally. You cannot gain altitude, instead losing ten feet of altitude with your movement. If you are unable to use your full movement to glide in this way, you lose your flying speed and immediately fall.

spell.name: Glimpse
entries: You touch 1 willing creature and grant them a glimpse of a future combat. Once before the power ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to 1 attack roll of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the attack. The power then ends.

spell.name: Gravity Pulse
entries: A wave of intense gravitational energy rolls outward from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a Strength save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d4} force damage and is knocked {@condition prone} as the forces pull them to the ground. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each level above 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 10d4}.

spell.name: Gravity Well
entries: You increase the natural gravity of your environment in a 50-foot-radius sphere, creating a gravity well of difficult terrain that attracts everything in its area. Each creature who begins their turn in the area or enters it must make a Strength save. On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone} and take {@damage 4d8} force damage. At the end of each of your turns for the duration, any creature who is {@condition prone} in the area takes {@damage 2d8} force damage and is pulled 15 feet toward the center of the gravity well. Creatures may make another Strength save at the end of each of their turns to stand and resist the influence. Loose objects that are smaller than a compact car and not being worn or carried also slide to the center of the area.

spell.name: Greater Concealment
entries: When you use this power, you render an immobile object completely {@condition invisible} for the duration. Even in bright light, the entirely undetectable object must be able to fit within a 30-foot cube. It does not cast a shadow and no sounds travel outside of it. If the object moves to a new space, if deals or receives damage, however, or if anyone within the concealed space uses a power or makes an attack that has an effect outside of the concealed area, the concealment ends.
You can render this concealment permanent by using this power on the same object in the same location every day for 1 year.

spell.name: Greater Elasticity
entries: You reach the limit of elasticity, stretching and reforming yourself in fantastic ways. You are immune to bludgeoning damage while in this form. You can extend your limbs up to 120 feet away from you. You can flatten yourself until you are no more than 1 millimeter thick, filling a 30-foot square with your razor-thin form. You can form a part of your body into the shape of an inanimate object of Medium size or smaller, such as making your fist into a 5-foot wide piston or your arm into a six-foot tall ladder. You can even reshape your whole body into an object or shape Tiny and Huge, though the object cannot be overly intricate or have working mechanisms, like a watch. No part of your elastic body can detach without injury, however, though you can create forms with holes in them, like a donut or a cage.
When you adopt the form of an object, you can adopt its shape as well as its color or appearance. You can end this power and return to a solid form at will.
You can also form your hand into a club or axe and use it to make a melee attack, dealing bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 7d8} plus your power ability modifier on a hit.
Work with your GM to determine the exact effects of the various forms you adopt. For example, you could use this power to do the following things:

items: Stretch your limbs to make a melee attack or use a touch power from up to 120 feet away.
Grapple and restrain someone by shaping into a cage around them.
Shape yourself into a park bench and be indistinguishable from one.

entries: And so on.

spell.name: Greater Insubstantiality
entries: For the duration, you can render every person and object that you choose within a 20-foot radius square around you insubstantial. For example, you could turn a car full of people insubstantial, allowing you to drive through a building. An unwilling target can make a Charisma save, and if it succeeds, it is unaffected by this power.

If an object or person moves further than 20 feet from you, they become substantial again. If an object or person becomes substantial in a solid object, they are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet they are moved.

spell.name: Greater Magnetokinesis
entries: As an action, you can lift, move, and bend a metal object roughly the size and weight of an SUV truck—20 feet in length and weighing 5,000 lb. Alternatively, you can use an action to lift, move, and bend a number of smaller metal objects equal to your power ability modifier. Each of the smaller objects must be no larger than a refrigerator—up to 10 feet in length and 500 lb. each. You can move objects at a rate of 60 feet per round, but not with precision; rather, you simply lift, push, or throw them in a direction.

Each round that you maintain {@status concentration}, you can use your action to crudely reshape and move the objects you control, or to throw one as an attack. For example, you could move a single shipping container and bend it into a protective barrier. Or you could lift several motorcycles and launch one each subsequent round at foes. You can choose to drop any objects you control as a free action.
When you use your action to launch an object at a foe in range, make a ranged power attack against a target in range. On a hit, you deal {@damage 4d12} bludgeoning damage.

spell.name: Greater Telekinesis
entries: You gain the ability to move or manipulate even larger creatures or objects by thought. When you use this power, and as your action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on up to 3 visible creatures or objects in range, causing the appropriate effects below. You can affect the same targets round after round or choose new ones at any time.

entries.name: Creature
entries: You try to move a Gargantuan or smaller creature by making a power ability contested by the creature's Strength check. If you win the contest, you move the creature up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond the range of this power. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is {@condition restrained} in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air.
On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest.

entries.name: Object
entries: You can try to move an object that weighs up to 10,000 lb. If the object isn't being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 60 feet in any direction, but not beyond the range of this power.
