If the object is worn or carried by a creature, you must make a power ability contested by that creature's Strength check. If you succeed, you pull the object away from that creature.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

spell.name: Hack System
entries: If you spend 1 minute accessing the relevant computer or security panel, you can hack any secured systems or devices except those with encryption or biometric security. When you hack or disable such systems, you go undetected unless someone uses an action to make an {@skill Investigation} check that beats a DC equal to 8 + your Intelligence modifier + your proficiency bonus.

spell.name: Hard Light Constructs
entries: minutes

You project a beam of hard light that takes the form of a simple inanimate shape that fits within a 30-foot cube. For example, you could create a wall in any simple shape you choose that fits within the space. It can be up to 30-foot long, straight, semicircular, or domed.
Alternatively, you can create a structure like a bridge, stairs, or a ladder.

You can also use a bonus action to move the construct around in range, at a speed equal to your own. This means that you can create a platform for yourself or others to stand on, allowing those atop it to fly at your normal walking speed. You can only create 1 simple object at a time with this power.
Each hard-light object can sustain 30 points of damage before is dissipates.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using this power with a slot of 6th level or higher, you can create 1 additional construct of the same size for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Haste-S5E
entries: Choose a willing visible creature in range. Until the power ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saves, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the {@action Attack} (one weapon attack only), {@action Dash}, Disengage, {@action Hide}, or {@action Use an Object} action.
When the power ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th or 5th level, you can target 1 additional creature, with a 6th or 7th level slot, you may target 2 additional creatures, and an 8th or 9th level slot, three.

spell.name: Heal Self
entries: You regain 70 HP as a surge of positive energy washes through you and ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Healing Factor
entries: You focus your power inwardly and knit tissue, flesh, and bone. For as long as you remain conscious, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 HP each minute). If you drop to 0 HP while this power is active but do not die outright, you automatically stabilize at 0
HP and the power ends.

spell.name: Helping Hand
entries: This power allows you to grow an additional prehensile limb of your choice. When you use this power, and then on each of your turns until the power ends, you can take the {@action Use an Object} action as a bonus action.

spell.name: Hovering Step
entries: When you use this power, you step so lightly and quickly that you rise off the ground an inch, hovering in place. You can use your normal movement to walk or {@action Dash}, but you always remain an inch away from the surface below you.

You can walk in this way on solid ground or across liquids, though you fall, land, and take falling damage as normal if you step off solid or liquid footing. Moving in this way does not activate pressure plates and allows you to walk across otherwise dangerous surfaces, such as acid or lava. When the power ends, you fall the inch back to whatever surface you are above.

spell.name: Hurl
entries: You grab and throw an object at a target with alarming strength. To use this power, there must be a Small or smaller object within reach that is not being worn or carried. Make a ranged power attack roll against a visible creature with range. On a hit, both the target and the thrown object take {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Ice Shape
entries: You touch ice or snow of no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a sheet of ice into a weapon or make a small passage through a wall of ice, if the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a solid ice door or its frame to seal the door shut.
The object you create can have up to 2 hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

spell.name: Ignite
entries: You can create a conflagration by combining fire with a fuel.

Target a 5-foot square in range and spray a flaming liquid at a point on its surface. The 5-foot area is now burning for the duration. Any creature that begins its turn in the square or moves into the square on its turn for the first time must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 2d6} fire damage.
The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Imitate Object
entries: When you use this power, you alter your appearance to exactly resemble a single Small or Medium sized inanimate object. The object must be a single, spatially continuous object and it cannot be detailed or have working mechanisms. When in this form, however, you still count as a creature, not an object.

You retain all your statistics when transformed in this way, though you can no longer see, hear, smell, taste, or communicate. At any time for the duration of the power, you can use your action to change your appearance in this way again, either becoming a different object or altering your current object.

Scanning equipment or superpowers that can see infrared and ultraviolet light can detect that the object is in fact a creature, but none of the 5 mundane senses can distinguish that the object is anything unusual.
Your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment when in object form.

spell.name: Impetus
entries: You create a gravity bubble in front of you that rapidly pulls you forward and pulverizes everything in your path, stopping at a visible point in range. Each creature in the path must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success, as you strike and push past each one. The gravitational bubble you create prevents creatures from making opportunity attacks against you as you pass them when you use this power. Using this power transports you to the end of the effect, which is either 30 feet or when you arrive at a solid object, but it does not use any of your movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increase by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Impossible Acrobatics
entries: You perform an act of superhuman acrobatics, like balancing on a fishing line in high winds, or doing a backflip into the open window of a car driving by at 100 mph. If you must make an {@skill Acrobatics} check, you automatically succeed. This action can be taken as a part of your movement or while staying in the same location. You can even defy the laws of physics when you do this, for example, by jumping off multiple walls and ceilings as a part of this action. If you do jump as a part of your movement, you can leap ten times your normal height or distance as well, even if this causes you to exceed your total movement.

spell.name: Impossible Strength
entries: Your strength surpasses the conceivable. When you use this power, you need not roll for any Strength skill check or save you make. Instead of rolling, you can act as if the result of your roll after modifiers is a 20. When making weapon and unarmed melee attacks (not power attacks), you may also treat the result as if you had rolled a 20. And when you calculate damage from an unarmed or weapon attack (again, not a power attack), you do maximum damage.
Finally, your maximum to lift, move, or carry multiplies by 1000.

spell.name: Improved Fly
entries: You take to the air with alarming speed. For the duration, you gain a flying speed of 240 feet (roughly 30 mph).

spell.name: Indomitability
entries: As a reaction when you fail a save, you can invoke this power to reroll a save you failed. If you do so, you must use the new roll. Regardless of the result, you gain resistance for 1 minute against any damage taken from the effect that triggered the save.

spell.name: Inertia
entries: When you fail a save against an effect that forcefully moves you, such as a Shove or thunderwave, you may use your
Reaction to use this power, granting you advantage on the roll. This reaction may occur after you roll, but before the GM has resolved the initial failed save.

spell.name: Infect
entries: A tendril of emerald-green mist coils out of your extended hand and envelops a visible target in range who has taken damage at some point in the past minute, but who has not received any healing. The green mist siphons into the open wounds, infecting the target. The creature must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 3d6} poison damage and be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Infrared Vision
entries: Your eyes shift to receive light in the infrared spectrum, providing you a heat-map of your environment. You can see living beings through walls, as well as power lines, sewers, and water pipes underground, and even residual heat signatures from recent passersby. When you use this power, you also gain {@sense darkvision} in range for the duration.
It does make discerning certain details more difficult, however; for example, reading a sign or seeing detail in cold environments is not possible with infrared vision.

spell.name: Innate Orientation
entries: As an action, you quietly orient yourself in your environment. You now have a reliable sense of which direction is north, your approximate altitude, a sense of the time of day at your location within 1 hour of accuracy, and even a rough estimate of your longitude and latitude.

spell.name: Inspire
entries: You shout words of encouragement and focus to your allies, bolstering them. Each you choose creature that can hear you in range gains temporary HP equal to your proficiency bonus and can end one instance of the {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition stunned} condition. What's more, you add 1 to the Team Morale pool.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Inspiring Strike
entries: You pull off an impressive attack against a foe, inspiring your allies with your impressive physical prowess.
When you hit a target with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to do an additional {@damage 1d8} damage, as well as to add 1 point to the Team Morale pool.

spell.name: Insubstantiality
entries: For the duration, your body and equipment become insubstantial and translucent, which grants you the following features:
Rolls to see you in bright light by sight have disadvantage.
You are {@condition invisible} in dim light or darkness.
You can pass through solid objects and creatures.
You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage and resistant to all other forms of damage except psychic.

While insubstantial in this way, you cannot use any other powers, make attacks, or interact with objects that are not insubstantial as well, though everything you were wearing or carrying when you used this power also became insubstantial with you. You can move in any direction by thought. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot.

The power lasts for the duration or until you choose to end it early. When the power ends, you immediately rematerialize in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved. If you pass through a creature as you are shunted, they take the damage as well.

spell.name: Interrupt Power

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you using a power

entries: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of using a power. If the creature is using a power of 4th level or lower, its power fails and has no effect. If it is using a power of 5th level or higher, make an ability check using your power ability. The DC equals 10 + the power's level.
On a success, the creature's power fails and has no effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the interrupted power has no effect if its level is less than the level of the slot you used.

spell.name: Keening
entries: You issue a horrific, high-pitched sound that disorients and damages all who hear it. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution save. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Targets that fail this save must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from their attack rolls and saves for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Kip Up
entries: As a bonus action while {@condition prone}, you can perform a kip up, rising from being {@condition prone} at a cost of only 5 feet of your movement.

spell.name: Lauch
entries: You suddenly apply upward telekinetic force or reverse the gravitational field directly beneath 1 foe or object standing on the ground in range, shooting them into the sky. The target must make a Strength save or be thrown 50 feet up into the air, or to the ceiling if that is lower, and fall back to earth taking {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage, and are knocked {@condition prone}. Objects that weigh significantly more than a human cannot be launched.

You can also choose to use this power to launch someone or something sideways or at an angle. If you launch someone into a nearby wall, they take damage as if they had fallen the distance that they travel.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the distance the target is launched increases by 20 feet and the damage by {@dice 2d10} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Lesser Mind Blank
entries: Until the power ends, you are resistant to psychic damage and immune to effect that would sense your emotions or read your thoughts, powers designed to find or locate you, and the {@condition charmed} condition.

spell.name: Lesser Restoration
entries: You touch a creature and can identify and end either 1 disease or 1 condition of {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned} afflicting it.

spell.name: Lesser Telekinsis
entries: You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. When you use the power, and as your action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on 1 visible creature or object in range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target each round or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected.

entries.name: Creature
entries: You can try to move a Medium or smaller creature. Make a power ability check contested by the creature's Strength. If you win, you move the creature up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward but not beyond the range of this power. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is {@condition restrained} in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air.
On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest.

entries.name: Object
entries: You can try to move an object that weighs up to 300 lb. If the object isn't being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction, up to the range of this power.
If the object is worn or carried by a creature, you must make a power ability check contested by that creature's
Strength. If you succeed, you pull the object away from that creature and can move it up to 30 feet in any direction within the range of this power.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a tool, opening a door or a container, retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

spell.name: Lighting Fence
entries: A lightning bolt jumps from your hand and forms a line in a place you choose, expanding into a wall of sparking electricity. The wall is 60-feet long, 20 feet tall, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} lightning damage, or half as much on a success. Each creature that ends its turn inside the wall or who enters the wall for the first time on a turn, must make the same save or take that damage. Any creature ending its turn within 5 feet of the wall takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage, as arcs of electricity jump from the wall and strike them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Limited Elasticity
entries: When you use this power, your body becomes elastic. You can extend your limbs 10 feet from yourself, allowing you to make unarmed and melee attacks from that distance.
What's more, you also have resistance to bludgeoning damage in this form.

You can form your body into simple shapes, like a rough cube, a sphere, a bowl, or a sheet, though you retain your size. You can flatten yourself until you are 3 inches thick, filling a 5-by-5 foot square with your body.

You can also form your arms and legs into simple shapes, like a club, paddle, hook, or ring, which you can harden to use as simple melee weapons with which you are proficient. They have finesse and reach properties and deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 2d8} plus your power ability modifier on a hit. No part of your elastic body can detach without injury. You can return to your solid form as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Limited Shapechange
entries: You assume the form of a different creature for the duration.

The new form can be of any creature with a challenge rating equal to your proficiency bonus or lower. The creature can't be a construct or undead, and you must have seen the sort of creature at least once. You transform into an average example of that creature, rather than a specific one, without any class levels or powers. You lose the benefit of any features from your class, ancestry, or other source and you can't use any special senses you have (for example, {@sense Darkvision}) unless your new form also has that sense. You can only speak if the creature can normally speak, though you cannot use other powers while transformed.

Your game statistics are replaced by those of the chosen creature, though you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. You also retain all your skill and save proficiencies, in addition to gaining those of the creature (use whichever has the higher bonus). You can't use any legendary actions or lair actions of the new form.

You assume the HP and Hit Dice of the new form, though your total HP in your new form cannot exceed the number of HP you had prior to using this power. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of

HP you had before you transformed. If you revert because of dropping to 0 HP, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. If the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 HP, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.
When you transform, you choose whether your equipment falls to the ground, merges into the new form, or is worn by it. Worn equipment functions as normal. The

GM determines whether it is practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, based on the creature's shape and size. Your equipment doesn't change shape or size to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form can't wear must either fall to the ground or merge into your new form, having no effect in that state.
During this power's duration, you can use your action to assume a different form following the same restrictions and rules for the original form.

spell.name: Lock Down
entries: You harry your foe with attacks, trapping them where they are. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage and has a speed of 0 until the beginning of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 4th

spell.name: Magnetokinesis
entries: You cause small metal objects to move, manipulating a number up to your power ability modifier at the same time.

From a distance, you can move each metallic object as if you were standing next to it, using your hands to do so, but cannot move an object too heavy for you to lift. When you move an object, you can cause it to shift position or to float through the air in range. You can control multiple metal objects with precision, though you cannot exert enough force to make attacks with this power.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd through 4th level, you can lift objects up to double your normal lifting capacity, and up to a number twice your power ability modifier. Using a slot of 5th level or higher, you can lift objects up to triple your normal lifting capacity, and up to a number 3 times your power ability modifier.

spell.name: Magnetokinetic Mastery
entries: You can lift, bend, and move metal objects in range, including objects as large as an 18-wheeler truck or as heavy as a tank. As an action, you can lift and move them at a rate of 60 feet per round, or violently reshape them, crushing a tank flat or a truck into a ball. Alternatively, you can launch an object each round at a target in range.

When you use your action to launch one of the objects at foes, make a ranged power attack against a target in range. On a hit, you deal {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage to each. When you throw extremely large or heavy objects (like train cars), creatures who are Large or smaller take double damage.
You can also use your action to mold nearby metal into a shield that floats around you, protecting you. The shield provides ¾ cover and can sustain 50 points of damage before it is destroyed.

spell.name: Manipulate Device
entries: From a distance, you can operate, disassemble, and rebuild a complex handheld metallic device. For example, you could field strip a rifle or open a mechanical lock. When doing so, the object floats in the air as if you were using the magnetokinesis power. You can also manipulate a weapon like a pistol or knife to make an attack with it remotely. As a bonus action, make the attack as if you were wielding the weapon by hand and attacking from the location of the weapon against a visible foe. Make a power attack against 1 target in range. On a hit, you do the normal damage listed for the weapon.

spell.name: MARTIAL STRIKE
entries: You focus your martial prowess into a superpowered melee strike against the vulnerable areas of a target within reach. You may channel this attack either through your fists or a melee weapon, though the damage dealt is as described below rather than the weapon's normal damage.

When you use this power, you must choose whether to inflict bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} damage of the chosen type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Mass Invisibility
entries: Up to 6 creatures you choose in range become {@condition invisible} until the power ends. Anything the targets are wearing or carrying are {@condition invisible} if they are on the target's person.

spell.name: Meditative Attention
entries: As an action, you sit or lay in a {@condition prone} position and center yourself, calming your mind and emotions while extending your awareness. For the duration if you remain {@condition prone}, you have advantage on {@skill Insight} and {@skill Perception} checks.

spell.name: Mighty Focus
entries: You tense your muscles and gather your strength. Until the end of your next turn, add your proficiency bonus to melee weapon attacks, unarmed attacks, and damage, as well as Strength skill checks and Strength Saving Throws.
If you already would add your proficiency bonus because you are proficient in the relevant skill, attack, or save, add it twice. This bonus does not apply to power attacks, however.

spell.name: Mimic Substance
entries: You can transform your body on a cellular level to perfectly mimic a substance that you touch. For example, if you touch a wooden desk, your body transmutes into wood or touch a penny to become copper. You retain all your statistics and abilities while in this transmuted form—somehow, despite being made of wood or copper, you can still speak, think, and use your powers.
You can only mimic relatively mundane, homogenous, solid substances with this power, like wood, steel, plastic, and cement, but nothing exotic, radioactive, or non-solid.
You could not become uranium or mercury, for example.

When mimicking a substance, you gain some of its properties, so if it conducts electricity, like copper, you are now immune to lightning damage and can conduct electricity harmlessly. If it is hard, like steel, you now have natural armor—add +3 to your Armor Class. If it is nonreactive with acid, like glass, then you too are immune to acid damage. If it is plastic or elastic, then you too can change your shape, either snapping back to your original form or retaining the new one. Work with your GM to determine the exact consequences of the substance you have chosen to mimic.

spell.name: Minor Concealment
entries: When you use this power, you enshroud an object fist sized or smaller in illusory shadow. Unless someone looks directly at it in bright light, it is {@condition invisible}. You can carry this object or leave it immobile, though using it for anything, such as firing a concealed weapon or unlocking a door with a concealed key, reveals it.

spell.name: Mire
entries: You choose a 10-foot square area of ground, making it sticky like thick mud and difficult terrain for the duration.

When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Strength save or be {@condition restrained} by the mire until the power ends.
To break out, a {@condition restrained} target can make a Strength check against your power DC. On a success, the target escapes and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the area of the muddy square increases by 5 feet for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Missile Salvo
entries: You launch a barrage of tiny missiles at a point in range.
Each creature in a 40-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 8d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Momentary Insubstantiality
entries: Until the end of your turn, your body and equipment become insubstantial and translucent, which grants you the following features:

items: Rolls to see you in bright light by sight have disadvantage
You are {@condition invisible} in dim light or darkness
You can pass through solid objects
You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage
You are resistant to all other forms of damage except psychic.

entries: While insubstantial in this way, you cannot use any other powers, make attacks, or interact with objects that you were not wearing or carrying when you became insubstantial, though you can move in any direction. If you move up or down every foot of movement costs double.

When the power ends, you immediately rematerialize in the spot you currently occupy. If you rematerialize in the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately shunted to the nearest available unoccupied space and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

spell.name: Momentum
entries: You lower your head and charge forward and, if you keep moving, virtually nothing can stand in your way. When you use this power and you move in a straight line up to your full movement, every creature in the line must succeed on a Strength save against your power DC or be knocked {@condition prone} and suffer {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage.

On a successful save, creatures take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}, but are instead pushed 5 feet to one side—their choice of which direction. Creatures smaller than Huge size have disadvantage on this roll.

If you encounter a solid object, you destroy or knock aside all but the stoutest of objects, doing {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage. For example, you could crash though a threefoot thick stone wall, but not through a 20-foot-thick mountainside.

spell.name: Mud Splash
entries: You conjure forth and hurl a glob of thick mud. Choose 1 creature in range or choose 2 creatures in range that are within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity save or take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), 14th level ({@dice 4d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d6}).

spell.name: Muscle
entries: Until the power ends, when you make a Strength check or Strength save, you can replace the number you roll with a 15.

spell.name: Nanite Aura
entries: You deploy a fleet of microscopic nanites, which swirl out from you and coalesce in a nearly {@condition invisible} cloud in a 30-foot radius around you. Creatures in that radius you choose when you use this power receive the nanite swarm's protection. This grants them advantage on all saves and other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against them until the power ends. In addition, when you deploy the nanites, select one creature type. When a creature of that type hits a creature protected by the nanite swarm with a melee attack, several nanite detonate in front of the creature's eyes, flashing with brilliant light. The attacker must succeed on a Constitution save or be {@condition blinded} until the power ends.

spell.name: Neural Shock
entries: A hum of ambient electricity and the smell of ionized air fills the area in front of you as a wave of electricity emanates from you, electrocuting the neural pathways of every creature you choose in a 60-foot cone. Each creature must make a Constitution save or take {@damage 10d10} psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.
Creatures take half as much and are not {@condition stunned} on a successful save. Robots make this save with disadvantage.
Inanimate machines that are not shielded from electricity are destroyed.

spell.name: Nightmare
entries: You point at 1 visible creature in range and send them into a nightmare of their mind's own devising.

The target makes an Intelligence save. On a failure, they see a hellscape around them, rather than their real environment, and are harassed by dark figments of their imaginations. They can still make attacks at things outside of their nightmare, but they do so with disadvantage since they cannot see them. What's more, each round, they take {@damage 1d6} psychic damage from the hallucination.

The target can use its action to investigate the nightmare, allowing them another Intelligence save. On a success, they see through the ruse and the effect ends. If it takes damage from a source outside of their nightmare, they may also make the save again.

spell.name: Noxious Mist
entries: You generate a 5-foot-radiussphere of nasty mist centered around you. Each creature other than you in that area must make a Dexterity save. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} acid or poison damage, and is {@condition blinded} until the beginning of your next turn. Creatures take half as much and are not {@condition blinded} on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Obscure
entries: A shroud or illusion of shadow emanates from you, making you difficult to see. In dim light and darkness, you are {@condition invisible} if you remain motionless. If you move in dim light or darkness, you have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks against being seen.

spell.name: Oxidizing Touch
entries: As an action, you transform your fingertips into corrosive surfaces, able to rust and destroy metals with a touch.

On this turn and for the duration, you may touch a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon, a door hinge, or a lock, and choose to corrode it, causing it to oxidize and rust. This corroding touch causes a metal weapon to take a permanent and cumulative-1 penalty to damage rolls. Metal armor takes a permanent and cumulative-1 to AC. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon or armor is destroyed. A single touch destroys ammunition made of metal. Furthermore, manufactured metal objects take {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage.
You can also use the power with great precision, etching lines or words into metal, rather than destroying it.

spell.name: Pause Projectiles
entries: When you or another creature in range is targeted by a ranged attack, you may use your reaction to pause time for the projectile midflight. For the duration, the projectile remains stationary in the air 10 feet in front of the targeted creature. Touching the paused projectile returns it to the timestream, causing it to continue its path and striking whatever is now in the location the original target.

spell.name: Pep Talk
entries: With stirring words, you inspire and refresh your allies.
Up to 6 visible creatures in range each regain HP equal to {@dice 2d8} + your power ability modifier. This power has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Persistence
entries: Gathering your strength, you brace yourself for the coming challenges. You gain {@dice 3d6 + 6} temporary HP for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, you gain 5 additional temporary HP for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Phantom Ride
entries: A quasi-real fully fueled motorcycle appears on the ground ready to ride in an unoccupied space in range. You decide the vehicle's appearance, but any of the parts of the vehicle created by the power vanish in a puff of smoke if carried more than 10 feet away from it.

For the duration, you and 1 creature you choose can ride the motorcycle (which has standard statistics). When the power ends, the motorcycle gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The power ends if you use an action to dismiss it or if the motorcycle takes any damage.

spell.name: Pin
entries: You tackle and wrap up a foe, pinning them down and crushing them with force. Make a melee power attack against a Large or smaller creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} force damage and is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Plot Armor
entries: As one of the protagonists of this superheroic story, you can't die... can you? When fail your 3rd death save, you can use your reaction to turn the failed death save into a natural 20 on the die to negate its effect.

Alternatively, if you are subject to an effect that would kill you, such as dropping to zero HP because of the disintegrate power, you negate the effect that would kill you, though all other effects still occur. Thus, the disintegrate power that dropped you to zero HP and should kill you would instead merely drop you to zero HP and render you {@condition unconscious}

spell.name: Pod Duplicate
entries: With this nefarious power, a master of plant life can capture a Medium or smaller humanoid in a botanical prison and grow a duplicate that serves them. The effect begins when you invoke this power, as a vicious, thorny vine extends from your hand and strikes a humanoid in range.

Make a melee power attack against the target. On a hit, the vine finds purchase and injects a special biotoxin into its victim, paralyzing them. At the end of their next turn, the victim makes a Constitution save against your power save DC. On a successful save, the victim awakens, but takes {@damage 8d10} poison damage and has the {@condition poisoned} condition for 24 hours. On a failed save, the victim is {@condition paralyzed} for the duration, as a Medium sized botanical pod encases them, leaving them {@condition unconscious} and {@condition restrained}, but otherwise unharmed. The pod has an AC of 15 and 30 HP and is immune to poison and psychic damage.

Over the subsequent hour of the power's duration, a second Medium sized pod grows next to the first. At the end of the hour, if the victim has not been removed from the pod, they become {@condition paralyzed} for 24 hours, as the other pod opens to reveal a life-sized copy of the original creature. The doppelgänger is a creature, formed without any equipment from plant matter, and can take actions and otherwise be affected as a normal creature. It is a perfect copy of the original, but it has none of their ancestral traits, class abilities or powers. It even has the original's memories, but it only knows the superficial facts of its life, not the details or nuances. It uses the following stat block:

trait.name: Duplicate
entries: The pod duplicate looks identical to its original and has crude copies of its memories.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pod duplicate makes 2 slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee weapon attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 feet, 1 target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

The duplicate lasts until it drops to 0 HP, at which point it reverts to inanimate matter and withers away instantly. If the pod duplicate dies, the pod holding the original also withers and dies, releasing its captive, who awakes and is no longer {@condition paralyzed}. If the pod holding the victim is ever destroyed while the pod duplicate still lives, the duplicate becomes aware of this fact, but otherwise continues as it was before, though it likely would want to inform its creator that their prisoner has escaped.

spell.name: Poker Face
entries: You focus on remaining calm and suppressing any signs of your feelings or thoughts to others. While you use this ability, others have disadvantage on {@skill Insight} checks against you.

spell.name: Portal Punch
entries: You punch or kick into the air, passing your attack through a portal and striking 1 visible creature in range. Make a melee power attack against the target. On a hit you deal {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage. Foes cannot make an opportunity attack as your limb retracts after your attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 1st.

spell.name: POW!
entries: In classic comic book style, you rear back and punch or kick a foe. Make a melee power attack against a target in range. On a hit you deal {@damage 1d12} bludgeoning damage.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d12} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d12}), 11th level ({@dice 3d12}), 14th level ({@dice 4d12}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d12}).

spell.name: Power Circle
entries: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20 foot tall cylinder of superpowered energy centered on a visible point on the ground in range. Glowing runes appear wherever the cylinder intersects with the floor or other surface.
Choose 1 or more of the following types of creatures: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead. The circle affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways:

items: It can't willingly enter the cylinder by non-superpowered means. If the creature tries to use teleportation or interplanar travel to do so, it must first succeed on a Charisma save.
It has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within the cylinder.
Targets within the cylinder can't be {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or possessed by it.

entries: You can elect to cause its power to operate in the reverse direction, preventing a creature of the specified type from leaving the cylinder and protecting targets outside it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the duration increases by 1 hour for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Power Climb
entries: You climb and hang onto walls and ceilings with ease, digging your hands into the surface and forming your own handholds. You can climb sheer walls and ceilings at your normal speed. While climbing, you can now jump from wall to wall, digging out handholds each time you land. When you do so, your jump distance is doubled.

spell.name: Power Device
entries: You provide electricity to a single electronic device of
Medium size or smaller, powering it for the duration. If you use this power to activate a second device, the first one loses its power.

spell.name: Powerful Throw
entries: As an Action, you may pick up a Medium or smaller object or creature weighing less than 200 lb. and throw it at another object or creature within 120 feet. If you choose to pick up a creature, you must first attempt to grapple them, if you aren't already, as a part of using this action this round. On a success, you may throw them this round as you would an object. Once you have picked up a projectile, you may throw it at another visible object or creature in range. When the projectile hits, the target makes a Dexterity save. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage. Regardless of whether the target makes the save or not, the projectile also takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage. If either the projectile or target are breakable objects, they explode upon impact, doing {@damage 2d4} bludgeoning damage to all creatures within 10 feet of the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every level above 3rd.

spell.name: Preemptive Attack
entries: As a foe approaches, you drop into a defensive posture and attack. When a foe enters your reach, you use your reaction to make a single melee attack against them.

spell.name: Primordial Flame
entries: A vacillating cloud of light and darkness descends on a visible creature in range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity save or take {@damage 1d8} damage. Whenever you use this power, you choose whether the damage type is radiant or necrotic. The target gains no benefit from cover for this save.
The power's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), 14th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).

spell.name: Primordial Wellspring
entries: A maelstrom of swirling light or shadow appears in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point in range. When the wellspring appears, each creature in it must make a Dexterity save. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. You choose whether the damage is radiant or necrotic. A creature must also make this save when it enters the power's area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.
The maelstrom moves 10 feet directly away from you in any direction you choose at the start of each of your turns.

spell.name: Private Sanctum
entries: You secure an area in range with your power. The area is a cube that can be from 5 feet to 100 feet per side. The power lasts for the duration or until you use an action to dismiss it.
When you use the power, you decide what sort of security it provides, choosing any or all the following properties:

items: Sound can't pass through a barrier at the edge of the warded area.
The barrier of the warded area appears dark and foggy, preventing vision (including {@sense Darkvision}) through it.
Any sensors can't appear inside the protected area or pass through the barrier at its perimeter.
Creatures in the area can't be targeted by divination powers or perceived in any way by technology.
Nothing can teleport into or out of the warded area.
Planar travel is blocked within the warded area.

entries: Using this power on the same spot every day for a year makes this effect permanent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, you can increase the size of the cube by 100 feet for each level beyond 4th. Thus, you could protect a cube that can be up to 200 feet on one side by using a slot of 5th level.

spell.name: Produce Water
entries: A wobbling sphere of water appears in your hand and remains there for the duration, dampening neither you nor your equipment. The power ends if you dismiss it as an action or if you use it again.

You can also attack with the water, although doing so ends the power. On use or as an action on a later turn, you can hurl the sphere of water at a creature within 30 feet of you. Make a ranged power attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and becomes wet, granting them disadvantage on saves against effects that cause cold or lightning damage until the end of your next turn.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), 14th level ({@dice 4d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d6}).

spell.name: Propel Projectile
entries: You magnetize a small metallic object and send it rocketing toward a target in range. Make a ranged power attack against a visible target in range. On hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can choose to propel 2 projectiles at 2 targets. Make a separate ranged power attack for each. Using a slot of 5th level or higher, you can propel 3 projectiles at 3 targets.

spell.name: Protect
entries: When a visible creature attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack still hits, you take half of the damage instead of the creature you are protecting.

spell.name: Psychic Blast
entries: You project a beam of dimly glowing psychic energy from your forehead at a visible target in range. Make a ranged power attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage and has disadvantage to maintain {@status concentration} on their check triggered by this damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Psychic Strike
entries: A wave of mental energy washes out of you, slamming into nearby foes. Each visible creature in range must succeed on a Constitution save or take {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and targets have disadvantage to maintain {@status concentration} on their checks triggered by this damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Psychometry
entries: When you touch an object, you discern a summary of the most significant events that occurred in its presence.

The insight might consist of an image of the item being used to commit a murder, or a scene of how beloved it was by someone. The more information you already have about the thing, the more precise and detailed the information you receive is. The information you learn is accurate but is imagistic and sensory, rather than verbally expressed.

spell.name: Pulse Wave
entries: You explode in a burst of telekinetic force, knocking back creatures and objects alike, either in a 30-foot cone in front of you, or 20 feet form you in all directions. All creatures in range must make a STR save or take 22 ({@damage 5d8}) force damage and are knocked back ten feet, or half and not knocked back on a successful save. Medium or smaller objects in range that are not being worn or carried automatically fail this save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you use this power with a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Quick Dodge
entries: When you are hit with a visible attack, you can use your reaction to try to quickly dodge away, adding +2 to your AC against the triggering attack. If this raises your
AC above the attack roll, the attack misses. The AC bonus then ends.

spell.name: Radiant Form
entries: As an action, you transform your body, and anything you are wearing or carrying, into a living embodiment of divine radiance. In this form, you shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for another 30 feet and gain a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration as glowing wings of light sprout from your back. Until you use an action to transform out of your Radiant Form or you are {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following features:

items: Immunity to radiant damage and resistance to fire damage.
Any creature who touches you takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage for each round they are in contact with your body.

You can emit a burst of flame in a 10-foot-radius sphere from your body. All creatures in range must make a Dexterity save against your power DC, taking {@damage 5d6} radiant damage on a failure or half as a much on a success.

spell.name: Radiant Wall
entries: You create a wall of blinding light on a solid surface in range up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or ringed up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. It is opaque and lasts for the duration.
When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity save. On a failure, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage, or half as much with a success.
One side of the wall, selected by you when you use this power, shines brightly within 10 feet on that side.

Any creature that can see that starts its turn inside the wall of within 10 feet of the designated side or enters it for the first time must make a Constitution save or be {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Rage
entries: As a bonus action, you can channel your power with focused primordial ferocity.
While this power is in effect, you gain the following benefits:

items: Advantage on Strength checks and Strength saves.
Melee attacks add your proficiency bonus to the damage.
Resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

spell.name: Rail Gun
entries: You launch a chunk of metal at incredibly high speeds in a line away from you, dealing devastating damage to everything in its path. Each creature in range must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Raise Morale
entries: You call on your allies to redouble their efforts. For the duration, rolls of an 18, 19, or a 20 add a point to the Team
Morale pool rather than just a 20.

spell.name: Rally
entries: You call on your allies to intensify their efforts. The creatures you choose in range who can hear and understand you gain advantage on attack rolls and saves until the start of your next turn.

spell.name: Rapid Barrage
entries: You dash this way and that across the field of battle, striking foes with impunity. Choose up to 5 creatures you can see within range to which you have an open path of movement.
Make a melee power attack against each target, dealing {@damage 6d10} force damage to each one you hit. You end this action at a location you can reach on foot within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot above 5th.

spell.name: Reactive Resistance
entries: You can roll a {@dice d4} and add the result to the save that triggered this reaction. On a success you take no damage and, on a failure, you take only half

spell.name: Reactive Endurance
entries: When you take elemental damage including acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder, you can use your reaction to gain resistance to the triggering damage. You retain this resistance for 1 minute, but if you already have resistance to this type of damage, there is no effect. If use this power again during the duration, the new resistance replaces the old one.

spell.name: Reckless Attack
entries: When you use this power, you throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. Doing so gives you advantage on melee attack rolls during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until the beginning of your next turn.

spell.name: Redirect Attack

time.condition: when you are about to be hit with

entries: Instantaneous

You deftly dodge and redirect an attack to strike a different nearby creature. When a visible creature is about to hit you with a melee attack, you can duck out of the way, adding +5 to your Armor Class against this attack only. If the attack misses, you redirect their momentum, causing them to strike another nearby creature within 5 feet of you.

spell.name: Reflect Damage
entries: Your extreme durability allows you not only to shrug off remarkable amounts of damage but to reflect it back at its source. When a visible creature makes an attack roll against you and does damage, you can use your reaction to reflect a portion of that damage (of the same type). Roll {@dice 8d10} to return that much damage or the total damage you suffered, whichever is lower, back at your target. For example, if they shoot bullets, the ammunition ricochets back at them, while a beam of fire bounces off you back at its creator. Swords rebound off and strike their wielders, and so on.

spell.name: Regenerate Self
entries: You manipulate your metabolic processes to quicken your body's natural healing ability. You regain {@dice 4d8 + 15} HP. For the duration of the power, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 HP each minute).

Your severed body parts (fingers, legs, tails, and so on), if any, are restored after 2 minutes. If you have the severed part and hold it to its place, the power instantaneously causes the limb to reattach

spell.name: Reincarnate-S5E
entries: You touch a dead humanoid or a piece of a dead humanoid. Provided that the creature has been dead 10 days or less, the power forms a new adult body for it and then calls its consciousness to enter that body, though if it isn't free or willing, the power fails.

The power fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's features to change. The GM rolls a {@dice d12} and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes.
The reincarnated creature recalls its former life and experiences and retains any capabilities it had in its original form.

spell.name: Repulse
entries: You emit a powerful gravitational wave, pushing away all in front of you. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Strength save or take {@damage 4d8} force damage and is pushed back 10 feet and knocked {@condition prone}, or half as much and they are not pushed or knocked {@condition prone} on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Retcon
entries: You are the hero of this story. If you miss with an attack roll, fail a skill check, or save, you instead use your reaction to succeed. Alternatively, when you take damage, you can use your reaction to reduce the amount of damage you take to 1 hit point.

spell.name: Retrocognition
entries: When you spend time at a location, you discern a summary of the most recent emotionally significant event that occurred at that location in the past. The insight might consist of an image of an abduction or marriage proposal.

The more information you already have about the location, the more precise and detailed the data you receive is. The intelligence you gather is accurate but is imagistic and sensory, rather than verbal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, you witness the past 3 emotionally significant events that occurred at the location.

spell.name: Rewind
entries: Either using a time power or simply traveling so fast that you travel back in time, you turn back the clock a few moments to undo what just occurred. Everything in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on you rewinds several seconds, returning the area and every creature and object within it to the beginning of your previous turn. Damage suffered is reversed; objects destroyed are remade.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 9th level, you may rewind time in a 120-foot-radius sphere.

spell.name: Ride the Lightning
entries: You transform into a bolt of lightning, electrifying a line up to 100 feet long and 5 feet wide, ending at a visible point in range. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity save.

A creature takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. When the bolt reaches its destination, you transform back into yourself as though you had teleported there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increase by {@dice 2d6} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Second Wind
entries: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain HP equal to {@dice 1d10} + your level.

spell.name: Secret Cache
entries: You hide a cache, and all its contents, on the Ethereal Plane. The cache can contain up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving material (3×2×2 feet).
While the cache remains on the Ethereal Plane, you can use an action to either recall it, so it appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you or send it back.

After 60 days, there is a cumulative 5% chance per day that the power's effect ends. This effect ends if you use this power again or if you choose to end the power as an action. If the power ends when the cache is on the Ethereal Plane, it is irretrievably lost.

spell.name: Sense Device
entries: As an action, you can stop and listen, attuning to the nearly silent hum of electronic devices in your vicinity. Until the start of your next turn if you do not move, you can hear the whirr of any closed electrical circuits within devices in range. You know the rough location and size of these devices—including appliances and cell phones, but not the gear of a Tech hero.

spell.name: Sense Metal
entries: Attuning to the nearly silent hum of electronic devices in your vicinity, you use your action to become aware of the presence of all metal and metallic objects in range, down to items as small as a paperclip for the duration. If the metallic object is one you would recognize on sight, you know what it is with this sense. Your sense can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you.

spell.name: Sense Vital Signs
entries: For the duration, you can sense the heartbeat, breathing rates, and muscle tension of certain creatures, effectively allowing you to read their emotions and surface thoughts.
Until the power ends, you become aware of every Small or larger visible creature not behind total cover within 120 feet of you.

As a part of your action, you can focus your mind on any single creature. You initially learn the surface feelings and state of mind of it—whether it is upset, guarded, suspicious, happy, sad, or otherwise. As an action, you can either shift your attention to another creature's vital signs or attempt to probe deeper into the same creature's condition. When you are sensing a creature's vital signs in this way, you are proficient in {@skill Insight} regarding checks against the creature and may double your proficiency bonus when you roll.

If you probe deeper and the target knows you are observing them, the target must make a {@skill Deception} check against your power DC. If it fails, you gain insight into its true state of mind (if any), its emotions, and something that it is focusing on, or trying not to focus on (such as something in its environment it worries over, loves, or hates). If it succeeds, the power ends.
Questions verbally directed at the target creature naturally prompts its feelings and bodily reactions, so this power is particularly effective as part of an interrogation.

You can also use this power to detect the presence of living creatures you can't see. When you use the power as your action during the duration, you can search for vital signs within 120 feet of you. The power can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you.
Once you detect the presence of a creature in this way, you can read its vital signs for the rest of the duration as described above, even if you can't see it, but it must still be in range.

spell.name: Sensory Focus
entries: You remain motionless and focus your senses outwardly, heightening your sight and hearing for the duration. When focusing your senses and remaining in the same space, you are proficient in {@skill Perception} if you were not before.
Further, you have advantage on {@skill Perception} checks, as well as advantage on initiative in combat when focusing on your senses in this way

spell.name: Shackle
entries: You call forth metal from either the area or from deep within the earth. Metallic bands fly at a foe, wrapping around them and crushing them. Make a ranged power attack against a visible creature in range. On a hit, they take {@damage 4d8} force damage and are {@condition restrained} by the metallic bonds. Once each round that you maintain your bind, you can use your action to deal an additional {@damage 4d8} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Shadow Aura
entries: Wisps of shadow emanate from your body, enshrouding you in a 5-foot, shifting area of darkness. Though you can see through these shadows without difficulty, you count as Hidden to other creatures, including those with {@sense darkvision}. Light cannot penetrate this darkness and you have resistance to radiant and fire damage for the duration. The shadows also muffle your sound, allowing you to move in perfect silence.

spell.name: Shadow Stride
entries: You gain the ability to enter a shadow and move inside it to another shadow within 500 feet. Both shadows must be at least the same size as you. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter the shadow, instantly know the location of all other shadows of sufficient size within 500 feet, and, as part of the move used to enter the shadow, can either pass into one of those shadows or step out of the shadow you're in. You appear in a spot within 5 feet of the destination shadow, using another 5 feet of movement to exit. If out of movement, you appear within 5 feet of the shadow you entered.
You can use this transportation ability once per round for the duration. You must end each turn outside a shadow.

spell.name: Shadowy Blast
entries: Necrotic energies emanate from your hand in a shadowy cloud, gradually forming an undulating sphere, which you hurl at a visible target in range.
Make a ranged power attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Shadow Self
entries: As an action, you transform your body, and anything you are wearing or carrying, into a living embodiment of entropy and decay taking on the appearance of an undead version of yourself, ringed with swirling shadows. In this form, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration as rotten wings of bone and sinew sprout from your back.

The area within a 5-foot radius of you is lightly obscured by the shadows, no matter the light conditions beyond those ranges. Until you use an action to transform out of your Shadow Self or until you are {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the following features:

items: Immunity to necrotic damage.
Any creature who touches use takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. They take this damage for each round they are in contact with your body.

As a bonus action, you can issue a tendril of entropic energies that strikes a visible creature within 10 feet of you. Make a melee power attack against the creature, dealing {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage on a hit.

spell.name: Shadowy Strike
entries: Your hands are swathed in smoky black spheres of swirling entropic energies, which smell of the grave. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and is {@condition frightened} of you until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Shape Metal
entries: You can warp and bend a piece of metal that can fit within a 5-foot diameter sphere in range. For example, you can bend the barrel of a pistol so it cannot be used, or a bar from a metal fence to wrap around a foe, or a lock so it cannot be opened, and so on. Very thick or dense metals, like a bank vault door, take multiple uses of this power before they warp significantly

spell.name: Shield of Tenacity
entries: You channel your inner grit to take a hit, or avoid one, granting you a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

spell.name: Shrapnel
entries: You attract metal fragments from your environment and hurl them at a location in range, where they explode outward in a devastating swirl of shrapnel. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere from the target must make a Dexterity save or take {@damage 8d6} piercing damage, or half on a save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Side Step
entries: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied visible space.

spell.name: Silent Step
entries: A veil of silence envelops you, suppressing any noises you might make. For the duration, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks that rely on moving silently.

spell.name: Singularity
entries: You form a tiny black hole at a visible location in range, creating a 100-foot-radius sphere of extreme gravitational disturbance; the area is difficult terrain. When you use this power, and at the beginning of each of your subsequent turns for the duration, every Large or smaller creature that you choose within 100 feet of the singularity is pulled 25 feet closer to it. Any creature who arrives at the singularity takes {@damage 10d6} force damage and is {@condition restrained}. At the beginning of its turn, a creature can make a Strength save to resist the pull. Creatures that succeed are neither pulled nor {@condition restrained}, and can move away from it, though the area remains difficult terrain for them. Loose objects that are smaller than a compact car and not being worn or carried also slide to the center of the area, where they are crushed into the singularity, destroyed.

spell.name: Skill Chip
entries: You program an algorithm boosting your ability with a particular activity. You are now proficient and have expertise in 1 skill of your choice. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this proficiency.

spell.name: Slippery Sweat
entries: You exude a slippery oil from your skin. When you roll an {@skill Acrobatics} check to escape being {@condition grappled}, you roll with advantage. When the power ends, the oily substance evaporates.

spell.name: Smash
entries: You concentrate your strength and unleash it on a stationary, inanimate object within reach. Make a melee power attack against the object. If you hit, your attack does {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Smite
entries: Your righteous anger infuses your fighting. When you hit a creature with an attack, you can expend 1 slot to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} damage with the attack.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sniper
entries: You can stealthily attack from afar with impunity. When you make a ranged attack, you can use your reaction to keep your location concealed.

spell.name: Snowball
entries: A well-packed snowball appears in your hand, remaining there for the duration and freezes neither you nor your equipment. The power ends if you dismiss it as an action, throw the ball, or use the power again.

You can attack with the snowball when you use this power, or as an action on a later turn, to hurl the snowball at a creature within 60 feet of you. Make a ranged power attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} cold damage and must make a Dexterity save against your power save DC or be {@condition blinded} by snow and ice in their eyes until the beginning of your next turn.
This power's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach
5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), 14th level ({@dice 4d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d8}).

spell.name: Solidarity
entries: As an action, you offer a pat on the shoulder and an encouraging word to an ally. When you use this power, your Movement drops to 0 for that turn, you can't take any reactions until the beginning of your next turn, and your turn ends, but you expend 1 Hit Die and your ally recovers that amount of Hit Points.
The number of Hit Dice you can expend on your ally increases to 2 when you reach 5th level, 3 at 11th level, 4 at 14th level, and 5 at 17th level

spell.name: Sonic Blast
entries: With a rumble, your hand begins to vibrate and the air around it blurs. Suddenly, a thunderous blast erupts and a narrow lane of vibrating air shoots away like a crashing sonic spear. Make a ranged power attack against the target.
If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Sonic Wall
entries: A wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick of intense, concentrated vibration rises from the ground at a point you choose in range. You can shape the wall in any way you choose so long as it makes a continuous path along the ground, and it lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Constitution save. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Creatures who fail their save are also {@condition deafened} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution save to no longer be {@condition deafened}.

The strong vibrations keep fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or smaller flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Loose, lightweight materials brought into the wall vibrate violently. Arrows, bullets, and other ordinary projectiles launched at targets behind the wall are deflected downward and automatically miss. (Missiles or tank artillery, and similar projectiles, are unaffected.)
Creatures in gaseous form can't pass through it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Spectral Guardian
entries: A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied visible space in range. The guardian is indistinct except for a gleaming sword and shield. Any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity save. The creature takes 20 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 60 damage.

spell.name: Stash
entries: You pocket an object that you can hold in your hand in a harmless demiplane you create when you use this power.
It remains there for the duration if you retain {@status concentration}.

At the end of the duration, the object reappears in the same hand, as though it had been there all along. Time passes as normal in the demiplane and the environment there is the same as it was at your location when you used the power. Once the power ends, the demiplane ceases to exist.

spell.name: Steam
entries: You bring together fire and water to shoot a gout of steam at a point in range. Alternatively, you can shoot only water at an open flame or flame at a body of water. When they meet, the fire is extinguished, a 5-foot cube of water is evaporated, and scalding steam is expelled. Each creature within 5 feet of the target must make a Dexterity save, taking {@damage 2d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

The steam cools immediately and a dense cloud of fog lingers for the duration, spreading to fill a 10-foot-radius sphere that spreads around corners and heavily obscures the area. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 mph) disperses it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Stick and Move
entries: You move around your opponent, striking when they are off balance, allowing you to slip away afterwards. Make a melee power attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} bludgeoning damage and cannot take reactions against you until the end of your turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Stomp Quake
entries: With a mighty stomp, you shake the ground with such ferocity creatures around you are thrown {@condition prone}. Creatures you choose within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution save or take {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage from the vibrating ground beneath their feet as well as {@damage 5d6} thunder damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that succeeds on its save takes half as much and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures flying or hovering are unaffected by this ability.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 5th level or higher, both the bludgeoning damage and the thunder damage increase by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Stress
entries: You release a wave of emotionally charged worry, anxiety, and mental angst that washes over creatures in front of you, causing a piercing migraine to distract them. Each creature within a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom save or take {@damage 5d6} psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll or skill check it makes before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Stun
entries: You direct a blast of energy at a visible creature in range.

The target must succeed on a Constitution save against your power DC or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn. The blast of energy conforms to your superpowers; if you use electricity, it's an electrical bolt, if you use the sound superpower, then it's a loud, directed wave of noise, using light or illusion, then it's a blinding beam of light.
Telepaths project no visible power transfer, though an intense stare is recommended.

spell.name: Sucker Punch
entries: Perhaps you become {@condition invisible} for a split second, move so silently as to evade notice, or strike at your target from a place they can't see well, or they glance away at an opportune moment. Regardless, they don't sense the hit coming and are caught off guard. Make a power attack against 1 creature in range. On a hit, you deal {@damage 2d12} bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: Using a slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st.

spell.name: Sudden Swerve
entries: Almost like flinching, you can attempt to teleport or leap to safety as you are about to be hit.
